posts.cooked: The question asks to use gpt-3.5-turbo-0125 model but the ai-proxy provided by Anand sir only supports gpt-4o-mini. So should we just use gpt-4o-mini or use the OpenAI API for gpt3.5 turbo?
posts.raw: The question asks to use gpt-3.5-turbo-0125 model but the ai-proxy provided by Anand sir only supports gpt-4o-mini. So should we just use gpt-4o-mini or use the OpenAI API for gpt3.5 turbo?

posts.cooked: Use the model that's mentioned in the question. If it specifically asks for gpt-3.5-turbo-0125, you should use that model even if you need to access OpenAI API directly.
posts.raw: Use the model that's mentioned in the question. If it specifically asks for gpt-3.5-turbo-0125, you should use that model even if you need to access OpenAI API directly.

title: GA4 Data Sourcing Discussion Thread TDS Jan 2025

posts.cooked: If a student scores 10/10 on GA4 as well as a bonus, it would appear as '110' on the dashboard, indicating 10 out of 10 plus the bonus point.
posts.raw: If a student scores 10/10 on GA4 as well as a bonus, it would appear as '110' on the dashboard, indicating 10 out of 10 plus the bonus point.

title: Docker vs Podman for TDS Course

posts.cooked: I know Docker but have not used Podman before. Should I use Docker for this course?
posts.raw: I know Docker but have not used Podman before. Should I use Docker for this course?

posts.cooked: While we recommend Podman for this course, Docker is also acceptable. The course materials are designed with Podman in mind, but Docker users can follow along with minimal adjustments.
posts.raw: While we recommend Podman for this course, Docker is also acceptable. The course materials are designed with Podman in mind, but Docker users can follow along with minimal adjustments.
